isis.stitle: CAB: 5000i AND 9000i CONVENTIONAL - REMOVE - CAB AIR SUSPENSION system for 9200i DAY CAB MODELS WITH DETROIT DIESEL ENGINES before march 1997

svcproc.title: CAB AIR SUSPENSION system for 9200 i DAY CAB MODELS WITH DETROIT DIESEL ENGINES before march 1997

warning.para: For safety purposes cab air suspension must be supplied from a pressure protected air supply.

svcprocinfo.para: Refer to Figure 112 for Items in parentheses.

The cab air suspension system for the 9200 i day cab models with Detroit Diesel engines before March 1997 contains one air spring (bag) (Item 4), two shock absorbers (Items 5 and 6), and is controlled by the height control valve (Item 7). The air suspension assembly (Figure 112) needs no lubrication and very little maintenance

The following components - air line (to air spring) (Item 13), hex nipple fitting (Item 11), elbow fitting (Item 12), air spring (bag) (Item 4), height control valve (Item 7), shock absorbers (Items 5 and 6) and lateral control rod (Item 3) - should be checked at the time the truck is being serviced. Immediate corrective action should be taken if a malfunction occurs.

note.para: The height control valve (Item 7), air spring (bag) (Item 4) and shock absorbers (Items 5 and 6) are serviceable and can be replaced individually.

svcsubproc.title: Remove Height Control Valve

note.para: If there is an attempt to disassemble or adjust fittings on the height control valve (Item 7, Figure 112) , it will void the warranty. Contact the air suspension manufacturer for assistance.

warning.para: To avoid personal injury, whenever any component is serviced or removed from air system, be sure to set parking brake and/or block vehicle wheels to prevent it from moving while service is being performed.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 113 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Press and hold release button against fitting body and pull air line (supply) (Item 2) from push to connect elbow fitting (Item 1) in "SUPPLY" port of height control valve (Item 3).
Press and hold release button against fitting body and pull push to connect elbow fitting (Item 1) from "SUPPLY" port of height control valve (Item 3).
Press and hold release button against fitting body and pull air line (to air spring) (Item 4) from "SUSP" port of height control valve (Item 3).

Remove height control valve linkage (Item 5) from threaded ball pivot (Item 6) by unlatching linkage clip and carefully pry the height control valve linkage socket from threaded ball pivot on height control valve arm (Item 7).
Remove two carriage bolts and hex lock nuts (Items 8 and 9) and remove height control valve (Item 3) from mounting bracket of crossmember mounting plate (Item 10).

svcsubproc.title: Remove Cab Air Suspension Shock Absorber
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 112 for Items in parentheses.

step2.para: Remove hex head bolt and hex lock nut (Items 18 and 19) at the top of shock absorber (Item 5).
Remove hex head bolt and hex lock nut (Items 18 and 19) at the bottom of shock absorber (Item 5).
Remove shock absorber (Item 5) from between cab mounting plate (Item 1) and crossmember mounting plate (Item 2).
Remove hex head bolt and hex lock nut (Items 18 and 19) at the top of shock absorber (Item 6).
Remove hex head bolt and hex lock nut (Items 18 and 19) at the bottom of shock absorber (Item 6).
Remove shock absorber (Item 6) from between cab mounting plate (Item 1) and crossmember mounting plate (Item 2).

svcsubproc.title: Remove Cab Air Suspension Air Spring (Bag)

warning.para: To avoid personal injury, whenever any component is serviced or removed from air system, be sure air system is drained and be sure to set parking brake and/or block vehicle wheels to prevent it from moving while service is being performed.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 112 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Loosen compression nut of elbow fitting (Item 12) at the top of air spring (bag) (Item 4) and remove air line (to air spring) (Item 13) from elbow fitting.
Remove elbow fitting (Item 12) from hex nipple fitting (Item 11) at top of air spring (bag) (Item 4).
Remove hex nipple fitting (Item 11) from top of air spring (bag) (Item 4).
Remove hex head bolt and lock washer (Items 21 and 22) from the top of air spring (bag) (Item 4) at cab mounting plate (Item 1).
Remove machine screw (Item 20) from the bottom of air spring (bag) (Item 4) under crossmember mounting plate (Item 2).
Slide air spring (bag) (Item 4) from between cab mounting plate (Item 1) and crossmember mounting plate (Item 2).

svcsubproc.title: Remove Lateral Control Rod
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 112 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove lateral control rod (Item 3) as follows.

step2.para: Remove hex head bolt (Item 23) and hex lock nut (Item 24) from mounting bracket of crossmember mounting plate (Item 2) and lateral control rod (Item 3).
Remove hex head bolt (Item 23) and hex lock nut (Item 24) from cab mounting plate (Item 1) and lateral control rod (Item 3) and remove lateral control rod.
